snippet: The six-hole golf course in rebel territory in Kachin State may be among the world’s unlikeliest, but it is open, even in wartime.
abstract: Laiza Journal; senior officers of the Kachin Independence Army play golf at the Laiza Golf Club in northern Myanmar, even as their troops engage government forces a short distance away; the six-hole golf course has remained open throughout the conflict.
lead_paragraph: The six-hole golf course in rebel territory in Kachin State may be among the world’s unlikeliest, but it is open, even in wartime.

headline.seo: Myanmar’s Guerrilla Golfers, Going a Few Rounds
headline.main: Myanmar’s Guerrilla Golfers Take Time for a Few Rounds
headline.print_headline: Myanmar’s Guerrilla Golfers Take Time for a Few Rounds
